SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am24.view.TUI

Class TUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am24.view.UI
it.polimi.ingsw.am24.view.TUI.TUI
public class TUI extends UI
The TUI (Textual User Interface) class extends the UI class. It provides various methods to display game information and interact with the user via the command line.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description

    Initializes a new instance of the TUI class.

      Parameters:

      gameView - The current game view.
      symbols - The list of symbols to display.
      Returns:
      The next index of visible symbols to be displayed.

    • show_lobby

      public void show_lobby()
      Displays the lobby menu, showing options to create a new lobby or join an existing one. The method first shows the game logo and authors/rules before presenting the options.
      Specified by:
      show_lobby in class UI

    • show_network_type

      Specified by:
      show_network_type in class UI

    • show_available_colors

      public void show_available_colors(ArrayList<String> colors)
      Displays the available colors that the player can choose from. The method highlights each color using ANSI color codes and prompts the user to choose a color.
      Specified by:
      show_available_colors in class UI
      Parameters:
      colors - The list of available colors to be displayed.

    • show_hidden_goal

      public void show_hidden_goal(ArrayList<GameCardView> views)
      Displays the player's hidden goals. The method lists the descriptions of each hidden goal and prompts the user to choose one.
      Specified by:
      show_hidden_goal in class UI
      Parameters:
      views - The list of GameCardView objects representing the hidden goals.

    • show_initial_side

      public void show_initial_side(ArrayList<GameCardView> views)
      Displays the initial card sides for the player to choose from. The method shows the game logo, lists the descriptions of each initial card side, and prompts the user to choose one.
      Specified by:
      show_initial_side in class UI
      Parameters:
      views - The list of GameCardView objects representing the initial card sides.

      Specified by:
      show_invalid_username in class UI

    • clearScreen

      public void clearScreen()
      Clears the console screen. The method handles different operating systems (Windows and others). If an exception occurs during the process, it is caught but not handled explicitly.

    • show_winner_and_rank

      public void show_winner_and_rank(boolean winner, HashMap<String,Integer> rank, String winnerNick)
      Displays the game result, indicating whether the player won or lost. The method also shows the final ranking of all players.
      Specified by:
      show_winner_and_rank in class UI
      Parameters:
      winner - Whether the current player is the winner.
      rank - The final rankings of all players.
      winnerNick - The nickname of the winner.

    • show_wrong_card_play

      Displays an error message indicating that the card placement was invalid.
      Specified by:
      show_wrong_card_play in class UI

    • show_joined_players

      public void show_joined_players(ArrayList<String> players, String current, int num)
      Displays the list of players who have joined the lobby. The method shows the game logo, the current player's name, and a list of all players in the lobby, indicating the current player.
      Specified by:
      show_joined_players in class UI
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players in the lobby.
      current - The current player's nickname.
      num - The total number of players required for the lobby.

    • show_no_connection_error

      public void show_no_connection_error()
      Displays an error message indicating that the connection to the server has been lost. The method waits for 3 seconds and then terminates the program.
      Specified by:
      show_no_connection_error in class UI

    • show_logo

      public void show_logo()
      Clears the screen and displays the game logo. The logo is printed using ANSI escape codes to handle different character sets based on the console environment.
      Specified by:
      show_logo in class UI
